parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Much, many; often.
A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Papyrus, paper. From the same as charax; a sheet of writing-material.
And, even, also, namely.
Ink. Neuter of melas as noun; ink.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.
A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
And, even, also, namely.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
